text: Human infections are largely subclinical with a rate varying from 1:25 to 1:1000 [3, 4] . The clinical symptoms vary from mild to severe disease including a non-specific febrile illness, meningitis, encephalitis and meningoencephalitis, the latter being observed in the most severe cases [4] [5] [6] . . Following an incubation period of 6-16 days, patients may develop fever, headache, vomiting, rigor and nausea [1, 4] . Subsequently, encephalitic cases develop neurological symptoms including seizure, tremor, photophobia, decreased sensorium, generalized and localized paresis, movement disorder [4, 6] .
